translate.name: translate
translate.percentages: relative to the width of the reference box (for the first value) or the height (for the second value)
translate.computedValue: the keyword none or a pair of computed <length-percentage> values and an absolute length
translate.animationType: by computed value, but see below for none

rotate.name: rotate
rotate.computedValue: the keyword none, or an <angle> with an axis consisting of a list of three <number>s
rotate.animationType: as SLERP, but see below for none

scale.name: scale
scale.computedValue: the keyword none, or a list of 3 <number>s
scale.animationType: by computed value, but see below for none

transform-style.name: transform-style
transform-style.usedValue: flat if a grouping property is present, specified keyword otherwise

perspective.name: perspective
perspective.computedValue: the keyword none or an absolute length

perspective-origin.name: perspective-origin
perspective-origin.percentages: refer to the size of the reference box

<transform-function>.prose: The value of the transform property is a list of <transform-function>. The set of allowed transform functions is given below. Wherever <angle> is used in this specification, a <number> that is equal to zero is also allowed, which is treated the same as an angle of zero degrees. A percentage for horizontal translations is relative to the width of the reference box. A percentage for vertical translations is relative to the height of the reference box. A percentage in a scale function is equivalent to a number, and serializes as a number in specified values. For example, scale3d(50%, 100%, 150%) serializes as scale3d(0.5, 1, 1.5).
